203.issueTitle: I want to dispute a Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Issued Because Tenant Does Not Qualify for Subsidized Rental Unit
203.issueHelp:
If applicable, provide evidence to show that the notice is not valid.

You must submit your application within 15 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the second page of the notice carefully.

234.issueTitle: I want to dispute a Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Issued Because the Tenant Does Not Qualify for Subsidized Rental Unit and I need more time to dispute this notice
234.textDescriptionTitle: Describe why you are disputing the notice and why you are filing late
234.issueHelp:
If applicable,provide evidence to show that the notice is not valid.

You must submit your application within 15 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the notice carefully.

206.selectionTitle: I want to dispute a 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of Manufactured Home Park
206.issueTitle: I want to dispute a 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of Manufactured Home Park
206.selectionHelp: This notice is used if the landlord will be converting the manufactured home park to another use.
206.issueHelp:
If applicable, provide evidence to show that the landlord does not intend in good faith to convert all or part of the manufactured home park to another purpose.

You must submit your application within 15 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the second page of the notice carefully.

236.issueTitle: I want to dispute a Twelve Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of a Manufactured Home Park I need more time to dispute this notice
236.textDescriptionTitle: Describe why you are disputing the notice and why you are filing late
236.selectionHelp:
This notice is used if the landlord will be converting the manufactured home park to another use.

You have the right to dispute this Notice within 15 days after you receive it. An arbitrator may extend your time to file an Application, but you must provide proof of your serious and compelling reason to miss the deadline.
236.issueHelp:
If applicable, provide evidence to show that the landlord does not intend in good faith to convert all or part of the manufactured home park to another purpose.

You must submit your application within 15 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the Twelve Month Notice to End Tenancy carefully.

237.issueTitle: I want my security deposit returned that the landlord is retaining without cause
237.noticeDueDateHelp: This is the date the tenant served the written forwarding address in person, attaching it to the door, placing it in the mail box or sending it by fax or mail. This information must also be provided on form RTB-41.
237.noticeMethodTitle: How address was provided to Landlord
237.issueHelp:
If the landlord has made a claim to retain the deposit(s), the application cannot be determined through the direct request process and must be determined in a hearing with the landlord's application.

Ensure you have read the information on our website carefully - it includes a list of evidence that you include with your application. If you are submitting your application too early, your application will be dismissed.

You must provide evidence below to support your claim for the return of your security and/or pet damage deposit.

238.issueTitle: I want my pet damage deposit returned that the landlord is retaining without cause
238.noticeDueDateHelp: This is the date the tenant served the written forwarding address in person, attaching it to the door, placing it in the mail box or sending it by fax or mail. This information must also be provided on form RTB-41.
238.noticeMethodTitle: How address was provided to Landlord
238.issueHelp:
If the landlord has made a claim to retain the deposit(s), the application cannot be determined through the direct request process and must be determined in a hearing with the landlord's application.

Ensure you have read the information on our website carefully - it includes a list of evidence that you include with your application. If you are submitting your application too early, your application will be dismissed.

You must provide evidence below to support your claim for the return of your security and/or pet damage deposit.

239.issueTitle: I want my security and pet damage deposit returned that the landlord is retaining without cause
239.noticeDueDateHelp: This is the date the tenant served the written forwarding address in person, attaching it to the door, placing it in the mail box or sending it by fax or mail. This information must also be provided on form RTB-41.
239.noticeMethodTitle: How address was provided to Landlord
239.issueHelp:
If the landlord has made a claim to retain the deposit(s), the application cannot be determined through the direct request process and must be determined in a hearing with the landlord's application.

Ensure you have read the information on our website carefully - it includes a list of evidence that you include with your application. If you are submitting your application too early, your application will be dismissed.

You must provide evidence below to support your claim for the return of your security and/or pet damage deposit.

201.selectionTitle: Are you filing your application after the dispute period indicated on the notice and requesting more time to file the application?  You must have a serious and compelling reason why your application is submitted late.  You must be prepared to show why you were unable to file your application within the allowable time
201.issueTitle: I am filing this application after the dispute period indicated on the notice and I am requesting more time to file the application
201.textDescriptionTitle: Please describe the reason you are filing late
201.selectionHelp:
Select this issue only if your timeline to dispute the notice has passed and you have a serious and compelling reason for filing your application late.

At the hearing an arbitrator will decide if the application can proceed. Learn more in our policy guideline.

The Residential Tenancy Branch cannot extend the time limit to dispute a notice after the effective date of the notice. For example, if the effective date of the notice is January 31st, and you request more time to file the application on February 1st, the time limit cannot be extended even if you have a serious and compelling reason for filing late.
201.issueHelp: You must provide evidence to prove that you had a serious and compelling reason for submitting the application late.  An arbitrator may not extend the time limit to dispute a notice to end if the application is filed after the effective date of the notice or you do not provide evidence to support the reason for filing late.

210.selectionTitle: I want compensation for my monetary loss or other money owed
210.issueTitle: I want compensation for my monetary loss or other money owed
210.textDescriptionTitle: Provide a complete list of the items you are requesting compensation for
210.selectionHelp: Select this issue for compensation for financial losses other than emergency repairs or the return of a deposit.
210.issueHelp: You must include all items for which you are applying for compensation and submit only relevant evidence to support your claim. Failure to list any items or provide evidence may result in those items not being considered. The total amount requested should reflect the complete total of all items listed. Any amounts claimed over the "Amount Requested" in the application may result in those amounts not being considered.

211.selectionTitle: I want part or all of my security deposit and/or pet damage deposit back
211.issueTitle: I want part or all of my security deposit and/or pet damage deposit back
211.noticeDueDateHelp: This is the date the tenant served the written forwarding address in person, attaching it to the door, placing it in the mail box or sending it by fax or mail. This information must also be provided on form RTB-41.
211.noticeMethodTitle: How address was provided to Landlord
211.selectionHelp: Select this issue if you have moved out of the rental unit and the landlord has not returned your deposit. You cannot request the return of the deposit while you are still living in the rental unit.  The landlord is not required to return a deposit until they receive your forwarding address. The landlord has 15 days after receiving your forwarding address and the end of the tenancy, whichever is later, to return the deposit or file for dispute resolution. You may be entitled to double the deposits if the 15 days have passed.
211.issueHelp:
You must provide evidence below that you provided your landlord with your forwarding address.

The landlord may only use a pet damage deposit for damage caused by a pet.

209.selectionTitle: I want to be paid back for the cost of emergency repairs that I made during the tenancy
209.issueTitle: I want to be paid back for the cost of emergency repairs that I made during the tenancy
209.selectionHelp:
Select this issue if you had to pay for emergency repairs to be completed because you were not able to contact the landlord.

There are very specific requirements in order to be successful with this claim. Learn more on our website.
209.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to prove your monetary claim.

202.selectionTitle: I want to dispute a rent increase that is above the amount allowed by law
202.issueTitle: I want to dispute a rent increase that is above the amount allowed by law
202.selectionHelp: Select this issue if the landlord has issued or charged a rent increase that does not comply with the law. Calculate when rent can be increased and by how much.
202.issueHelp:
You must provide a copy of the landlord's notice of rent increase or proof of unlawful rent increase below to support your claim.

A landlord's notice of rent increase must be on the approved form and cannot be more than the amount set out allowed by law.

222.selectionTitle: I want to reduce rent for repairs, services or facilities agreed upon but not provided
222.issueTitle: I want to reduce rent for repairs, services or facilities agreed upon but not provided
222.selectionHelp: Select this issue if you are requesting a reduction to the amount of rent payable because the rental unit or site requires repairs or the landlord is not providing services or facilities agreed upon in the tenancy agreement.
222.issueHelp: You must state how much of a rent reduction you are seeking and provide evidence to support why an arbitrator should order a decrease in the amount of rent payable.

213.selectionTitle: I need the landlord to make emergency repairs for health or safety reasons.  I have contacted the landlord to make repairs but they have not been completed
213.issueTitle: I need the landlord to make emergency repairs for health or safety reasons.  I have contacted the landlord to make repairs but they have not been completed
213.noticeMethodTitle: How will you serve within 1 day?
213.selectionHelp:
Select this issue if you are requesting emergency repairs that are necessary for health or safety or for the preservation or use of rental property. These are typically limited to major leaks in pipes or the roof; damaged or blocked water or sewer pipes or plumbing fixtures; necessary urgent repairs to the primary heating system or electrical system.

There are very specific requirements in order to be successful with this claim. Learn more on our website.
213.issueHelp:
You must provide evidence below to support your claim for emergency repairs. The Notice of Dispute Resolution must be served to each respondent within 1 day of receiving it from the Residential Tenancy Branch. Service options include: in person with a witness, post to the door with a witness, by registered mail or by email. You may serve the Notice Package by email only when the other party has clearly agreed to accept documents by email.

There are very specific requirements in order to be successful with this claim. Learn more on our website.

214.selectionTitle: I want repairs made to the unit, site or property.  I have contacted the landlord in writing to make repairs but they have not been completed
214.issueTitle: I want repairs made to the unit, site or property.  I have contacted the landlord in writing to make repairs but they have not been completed
214.selectionHelp:
Select this issue if you want repairs made to the unit, site or property and have contacted the landlord in writing requesting the repairs be made, but they have not been completed.

You must submit a written request to the landlord to complete the repairs. You are responsible to repair any damage that you, your guests or your pets have caused.
214.issueHelp:
You must provide evidence to show that you notified the landlord of the need for repairs and provided the landlord a reasonable amount of time to complete the repairs.

You may request a rent reduction if the landlord takes too long to make the repairs by selecting "I want to reduce rent for repairs, services or facilities agreed upon but not provided" on the previous step.

219.selectionTitle: I want the landlord to allow access to the unit or site for me and/or my guests
219.issueTitle: I want the landlord to allow access to the unit or site for me and/or my guests
219.selectionHelp: The landlord cannot unreasonably restrict access to a rental unit or site for a tenant or the tenant's guests.
219.issueHelp: If the landlord is restricting access to the rental unit or site, you should provide evidence to show how the landlord is preventing access.

215.selectionTitle: I want the landlord to provide services or facilities required by the tenancy agreement or law
215.issueTitle: I want the landlord to provide services or facilities required by the tenancy agreement or law
215.selectionHelp:
A landlord cannot terminate or restrict essential services. Essential services may include, but are not limited to water, electricity and heat. Learn more on our website.

Landlords are permitted to terminate or restrict a non-essential service or facility as long as they use the proper form allowing for 30 days of notice and reduce the rent by the equivalent amount to the service or facility being restricted or terminated.
215.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to prove that the landlord has withheld essential services or facilities.

218.issueTitle: I want to obtain an order of possession of the rental unit or site
218.noticeMethodTitle: How will you serve within 1 day?
218.selectionHelp: The landlord has changed the locks or is otherwise not allowing you to access to the rental unit.
218.issueHelp: You should provide evidence below to prove that the landlord is preventing access to the rental unit or site. The Notice of Dispute Resolution must be served to each respondent within 1 day of receiving it from the Residential Tenancy Branch. Service options include: in person with a witness, post to the door with a witness, by registered mail or by email. You may serve the Notice Package by email only when the other party has clearly agreed to accept documents by email.

217.selectionTitle: I want to suspend or set conditions on the landlord's right to enter the rental unit or site
217.issueTitle: I want to suspend or set conditions on the landlord's right to enter the rental unit or site
217.selectionHelp: A landlord can only enter your rental unit or site if you agree, there is an emergency or you receive 24 hours' written notice.  If the landlord is continually unlawfully entering the rental unit, select this option.
217.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to prove why the landlord's right to enter should be restricted.

220.selectionTitle: I want authorization to change the locks to the rental unit
220.issueTitle: I want authorization to change the locks to the rental unit
220.selectionHelp: You must not change the locks on the rental unit without either the landlord's consent or an order from the Residential Tenancy Branch.
220.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to prove why the locks should be changed without providing the landlord a key.

216.selectionTitle: I want the landlord to return my personal property
216.issueTitle: I want the landlord to return my personal property
216.selectionHelp:
Select this issue if the landlord has removed your personal property or prevented you from accessing it.

A landlord is not permitted to remove your personal property or prevent you from accessing it. If you have left items behind after the end of your tenancy and more than 60 days have passed, click here to learn more about items left behind.
216.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to prove that the property needs to be returned.

221.selectionTitle: I want to be allowed to assign or sublet and the landlord's permission has been unreasonably withheld
221.issueTitle: I want to be allowed to assign or sublet and the landlord's permission has been unreasonably withheld
221.selectionHelp:
Select this issue if the landlord has unreasonably withheld consent to assign a tenancy agreement or sublet the rental unit or site.

A landlord cannot unreasonably withhold consent to assign a tenancy agreement or sublet the rental unit if there are six months or more remaining in a fixed term tenancy agreement.

You must first submit a request to the landlord in writing and should be prepared to provide evidence to prove the landlord is unreasonably withholding the consent.

Learn more on our website.
221.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below to support your claim including the fixed-term tenancy agreement and proof that the landlord has unreasonably withheld consent.

212.selectionTitle: I want the landlord to comply with the Act, regulation and/or the tenancy agreement
212.issueTitle: I want the landlord to comply with the Act, regulation and/or the tenancy agreement
212.selectionHelp: I am seeking an order that the landlord comply with the Act, regulations or tenancy agreement.
212.issueHelp: You must provide evidence below that the landlord is not complying with the Act, regulations or tenancy agreement.

224.selectionTitle: I want to dispute a <b>Four Month Notice to End Tenancy<b> for Demolition, or Conversion to Another Use
224.issueTitle: I want to dispute a Four Month Notice to End Tenancy for Demolition, or Conversion to Another Use
224.selectionHelp: This notice is used if the landlord requires the rental unit to be vacant to demolish the rental unit or site or convert the unit to another use.
224.issueHelp:
If applicable, provide evidence to show that the landlord does not intend in good faith to use the property for the purpose stated on the notice.

You must submit your application within 30 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the second page of the notice carefully.

225.issueTitle: I have another issue that is not listed

235.issueTitle: I want to dispute a Four Month Notice to End Tenancy for Demolition, or Conversion to Another Use and I need more time to dispute this notice
235.textDescriptionTitle: Describe why you are disputing the notice and why you are filing late
235.selectionHelp:
This notice is used if the landlord requires the rental unit to be vacant to demolish the rental unit or site or convert the unit to another use.

You have the right to dispute this Notice within 30 days after you receive it. An arbitrator may extend your time to file an Application, but you must provide proof of your serious and compelling reason to miss the deadline.
235.issueHelp:
If applicable, provide evidence to show that the landlord does not intend in good faith to use the property for the purpose stated on the notice.

You must submit your application within 30 days of receiving this notice. If you file your application too late, the landlord may request an order of possession. Verify that your dispute deadline has not passed.

Ensure you have read the information on the second page of the notice carefully.

240.selectionTitle: I am occupying a room in a residential hotel and I want the Residential Tenancy Branch to determine whether they have jurisdiction over my tenancy
240.issueTitle: I am occupying a room in a residential hotel and I want the Residential Tenancy Branch to determine whether they have jurisdiction over my tenancy
240.selectionHelp: Select this option if you are living in a residential hotel and you want to know whether the Residential Tenancy Act applies to your tenancy

241.selectionTitle: I want an Arbitrator to end the tenancy because the rental unit or site is uninhabitable due to events out of my control and the tenancy agreement is frustrated
241.issueTitle: I want an Arbitrator to end the tenancy because the rental unit or site is uninhabitable due to events out of my control and the tenancy agreement is frustrated

242.issueTitle: The arbitrator is ordering an order of possession for the landlord on a Tenant Application

243.issueTitle: I want compensation because my tenancy ended as a result of a two, four, or 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy, and the landlord has not complied with the Act or used the rental unit/site for the stated purpose
243.issueHelp:
A tenant may apply for this where a landlord:

  • has not accomplished the stated purpose for ending the tenancy within a reasonable period of time; or
  • has not used the rental unit for the stated purpose for at least 6 months within a reasonable period of time; or
  • failed to give the tenant a notice of availability (Form #RTB-35) at least 45 days before the rental unit will be available to rent.

To learn more about claims for compensation related to a landlord's use of property, view the applicable policy guideline:

  • Compensation for Ending a Tenancy (Residential Tenancy Act)
  • Ending a Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Agreement - Landlord Use of Property

244.issueTitle: The arbitrator is granting the landlord a monetary order for unpaid rent on a tenant application
244.issueHelp: An arbitrator will determine who should be responsible for the cost of the application at the hearing.

245.issueTitle: I want to dispute an Additional Rent Increase for Capital Expenditures
245.selectionHelp: Select this issue if the landlord has issued a Notice of Rent Increase (#RTB-7 or #RTB-11A) or a Notice of Additional Rent Increase - Eligible Capital Expenditures (RTB-53) that does not comply with the law. Learn more about rent increases and additional rent increases.
245.issueHelp: You must provide a copy of the landlord's Notice of Additional Rent Increase (with attached detail document) and a copy of the Additional Rent Increase Decision to support your claim. Provide details for the amount requested that is over the amount allowed by the law and describe why.

246.issueTitle: I want compensation from the landlord related to a fixed term tenancy with a requirement to vacate the rental unit at the end of the term
246.issueHelp:
A tenant may apply for this where a landlord has ended a fixed term tenancy with a requirement to vacate, and:

  • has not taken steps to accomplish the stated purpose, within a reasonable period from the date the tenancy ended; or
  • has not used the rental unit for the stated purpose for at least 6 months within a reasonable period from the date the tenancy ended.

223.selectionTitle: Do you want to include a request for the landlord to pay you back for the cost of the filing fee?
223.issueTitle: I want to include a request for the landlord to pay me back for the cost of the filing fee
223.issueHelp: An arbitrator will determine who should be responsible for the cost of the application at the hearing.

51.title: Tenancy Agreement
51.helpHtml:
IMPORTANT! Only Tenancy Agreements are permitted to be submitted here. If you have other evidence it should be uploaded into one of the appropriate fields above.
Provide a copy of the most recent Tenancy Agreement outlining the terms of the tenancy. Please include any addendums.

101.title: Proof of Threat
101.helpHtml: Provide proof of the immediate and serious threat the tenant poses.  This can include photos, witness statements, written communications, audio or video recordings, police file numbers any other evidence to support that the tenant is an immediate threat to life or property.

102.title: Monetary Order Worksheet
102.helpHtml: Provide a completed Monetary Order Worksheet (form RTB-37) to provide a detailed calculation of your monetary claim. Download a copy here .

103.title: Proof of Damage
103.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the damage was caused by the tenant, their pets or their guests.  Evidence may include proof of the age and original price/cost of items damaged, photos or video recordings of the unit before and after damage occurred, receipts or estimates for repairs (receipts are better), expert reports showing repairs were not regular wear and tear or proof of age of item to be repaired.

104.title: Condition Inspection Reports
104.helpHtml:
Provide documentation to prove the condition of the rental unit.
Include a copy of the completed Condition Inspection Reports (form RTB-27) showing the condition of the rental unit at the start of the tenancy and, if applicable, at the end of the tenancy. Include attempts to schedule the condition inspection with the tenant, a copy of the Notice of Final Opportunity to Schedule a Condition Inspection (form RTB-22) if used (and proof of its service), and proof that you provided the tenant with a copy of the completed condition inspection report at the start and, if applicable, the end of the tenancy.

105.title: Other Proof of Damage
105.helpHtml: Provide any other evidence to prove that the damage was caused by the tenant. This could include written communications with the tenant about the damage or repairs to the damage, witness statements or any other evidence to show that the damage was caused by the tenant, their pets or their guests.

106.title: Proof of Money Owed
106.helpHtml: Provide proof of the amount owed to you. This could include strata fines, proof of rental loss or costs of re-renting the rental unit, late fees or any other evidence to show the financial loss or other money owed.

107.title: Proof of Money Owed
107.helpHtml: Provide proof of rent owing.  This may include rent ledgers, account statements, written communications with the tenant about unpaid rent or any other evidence to show the amount of rent owing.

108.title: Tenancy Agreement
108.helpHtml:
IMPORTANT! Only Tenancy Agreements are permitted to be submitted here. If you have other evidence it should be uploaded into one of the appropriate fields above.
Provide a copy of the most recent Tenancy Agreement outlining the terms of the tenancy. Please include any addendums.

110.title: Other Proof of Agreement
110.helpHtml: Provide any other proof of agreement.  This may include written communications with the tenant about the end of the fixed-term agreement.

111.title: One Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
111.helpName: One Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
111.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the notice delivered to the tenant.  You must use the approved One Month Notice to End Tenancy for Cause or for End of Employment (form RTB-33 or RTB-33s).  A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

112.title: Proof of Cause
112.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the cause is warranted. Evidence may include photos, witness statements, written communications, audio or video recordings, police file numbers any other evidence to support that the landlord has cause under the Act to end the tenancy.

113.title: Proof of End of Employment
113.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the rental unit or site was provided as part of the tenant's employment and that the tenant's employment has ended.

114.title: Proof of Service One Month Notice - RTB 34
114.helpName: Proof of Service One Month Notice - RTB 34
114.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here

115.title: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
115.helpName: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
115.helpHtml:
Provide a copy of the notice delivered by the landlord. The landlord must use the approved four-page Two Month Notice to End Tenancy for Landlord's Use of Property (form RTB-32). You are not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

There is important information on the notice that you should read carefully.

116.title: Proof Notice Is Valid
116.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you intend in good faith to do what is indicated on the notice. Review our good faith requirement policy guideline .

117.title: Proof of Service Two Month Notice
117.helpName: Proof of Service Two Month Notice
117.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here.

118.title: Proof Tenant Does Not Qualify for Subsidized Housing
118.helpName: Proof Tenant Does Not Qualify for Subsidized Housing
118.helpHtml: Provide other evidence to prove that the tenant does not qualify for subsidized housing.  This may include copies of letters requesting proof of current income, a copy of the criteria for subsidized housing and documentation to show that the tenant does not meet the criteria.

119.title: Mutual Agreement to End Tenancy
119.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the Mutual Agreement to End Tenancy (form RTB-8).

120.title: Other Proof of Agreement
120.helpHtml: Provide any other proof of your mutual agreement with the tenant to end the tenancy such as other written communications with the tenant.

121.title: Written Notice to End Tenancy
121.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the tenant's written notice to end tenancy.

122.title: Other Proof of Notice to End Tenancy
122.helpName: Other Proof of Notice to End Tenancy
122.helpHtml: Provide other proof that the tenant is requesting an end of tenancy (i.e. written communications with the tenant about ending the tenancy).

123.title: 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy Form - RTB 30
123.helpName: 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy Form - RTB 30
123.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the notice delivered to the tenant.  You must use the approved 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy for Unpaid Rent or Utilities (form RTB-30).  A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

124.title: Proof of Service 10 Day Notice - RTB 34
124.helpName: Proof of Service 10 Day Notice - RTB 34
124.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here

126.title: 30 Day Written Demand Letter
126.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the 30 Day Written Demand Letter that was served to the tenant requesting the tenant pay utilities or both rent and utilities.

127.title: Utility Bills
127.helpHtml: Provide a copy of unpaid utility bills.

128.title: Direct Request Worksheet - RTB 46
128.helpHtml: Provide a completed Direct Request Worksheet (form RTB-46) to provide a detailed calculation of your monetary claim for unpaid rent. Download a copy here.

129.title: Proof of Service Written Demand to Pay Utilities - RTB 34
129.helpName: Proof of Service Written Demand to Pay Utilities - RTB 34
129.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here

131.title: Condition Inspection Reports
131.helpHtml: Provide documentation to prove the condition of the rental unit. Include a copy of the completed Condition Inspection Reports (form RTB-27) showing the condition of the rental unit at the start and end of the tenancy, attempts to schedule the condition inspection with the tenant, a copy of the Notice of Final Opportunity to Schedule a Condition Inspection (form RTB-22) if used (and proof of its service), and proof that you provided the tenant with a copy of the completed condition inspection report at the start and the end of the tenancy.

132.title: Proof of Service 10 Day Notice - RTB 34
132.helpName: Proof of Service 10 Day Notice - RTB 34
132.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here

133.title: Other Rent Information
133.helpHtml: Provide any other information about the amount of rent or utilities owing.  This could include Notice of Rent Increases, demand letters for payment of utilities if required under the tenancy agreement or any other written communications with the tenant related to rent.

134.title: Proof of Money Owed
134.helpHtml: Provide proof of the amount owed to you. This could include receipts, invoices, estimates, account statements or any other evidence to show the amount of money required to repair the damage.

135.title: Proof Notice Is Valid
135.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you intend in good faith to convert all or part of the manufactured home park to another use. Review our good faith requirement policy guideline .

136.title: Proof of Service 12 Month Notice - RTB 34
136.helpName: Proof of Service 12 Month Notice - RTB 34
136.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here

137.title: Other Evidence
137.helpHtml: Provide any additional evidence to support claim of money owed.  This could include: tenant ledger or rent receipts, Notice of Rent Increase form(s) and/or receipts for rent paid since the 10 Day Notice was issued to tenant and/or tenant rent contribution letters.

138.title: Proof of Money Owed
138.helpHtml: Provide proof of rent owing.  This may include rent ledgers, account statements, written communications from the tenant about unpaid rent or any other evidence to show the amount of rent owing.

139.title: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, One Month Notice
139.helpName: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, One Month Notice
139.helpHtml: If the One Month Notice to End Tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

140.title: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, Two Month Notice
140.helpName: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, Two Month Notice
140.helpHtml: If the Two Month Notice to End Tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

141.title: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, 12 Month Notice
141.helpName: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, 12 Month Notice
141.helpHtml: If the 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

142.title: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, 10 Day Notice
142.helpName: Registered mail receipt or fax confirmation, 10 Day Notice
142.helpHtml: If the 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

143.title: Mail receipt or fax confirmation for Written Demand to Pay Utilities
143.helpName: Mail receipt or fax confirmation for Written Demand to Pay Utilities
143.helpHtml: If the 30 Day Written Demand Letter was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

144.title: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
144.helpName: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
144.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the notice delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved three-page Four Month Notice to End Tenancy for Demolition, Renovation, or Conversion to Another Use (RTB-29). A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

145.title: Proof Notice is Valid
145.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you intend in good faith to do what is indicated on the notice. Review our good faith requirement policy guideline.

146.title: Proof of Service Four Month Notice - RTB 34
146.helpName: Proof of Service Four Month Notice - RTB 34
146.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.
Download a copy here.

147.title: Registered mail receipt of fax confirmation, Four Month Notice
147.helpName: Registered mail receipt of fax confirmation, Four Month Notice
147.helpHtml: If the Four Month Notice to End Tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt.  If sent by fax, provide fax confirmation and proof that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

148.title: Proof of capital expenditure(s)
148.helpHtml: Examples could include receipts and invoices.

149.title: Proof Installations, repairs or replacements were required
149.helpName: Proof Installations, repairs or replacements were required
149.helpHtml: Examples could include depreciation reports, engineering reports, pictures or any other documented proof that the installation, repair or replacement was required.

150.title: Proof Installations, repairs or replacements are completed
150.helpName: Proof Installations, repairs or replacements are completed
150.helpHtml: Examples could include pictures of the completed installation, repair or replacement.

151.title: Associated work permits
151.helpHtml: Examples could include work permits required for the installation, repair or replacement.

152.title: Rent Repayment Plan
152.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the Rent Repayment Plan issued to the tenant.

153.title: Permits or approvals for the renovations or repairs
153.helpName: Permits or approvals for the renovations or repairs
153.helpHtml:
Renovations or repairs that are so extensive they require the rental unit to be vacant almost always require permits. Permits for renovations or repairs fall under broad categories including building, demolition and plumbing permits. These are obtained through local governments.
Landlords may also need electrical and gas permits. In general, the BC Safety Authority issues electrical and gas permits, however, some local governments may issue these permits.
Check with the local government where the rental unit is located to find out their requirements for all permits and inspections. Find your local government.
You can learn more about permit requirements on the Residential Tenancy Branch website and Policy Guideline 2B: Ending a Tenancy to Demolish, Renovate, or Convert a Rental Unit to a Permitted Use.

154.title: Proof Vacancy is required
154.helpHtml: The landlord must prove that vacant possession is required to perform the renovation or repairs and have all required permits and/or approvals. For more information see Policy Guideline 2B: Ending a Tenancy to Demolish, Renovate, or Convert a Rental Unit to a Permitted Use.

155.title: Proof that permits or approvals are not required
155.helpName: Proof that permits or approvals are not required
155.helpHtml:
If permits are not required for the work, a landlord must provide evidence, such as confirmation from a certified tradesperson or copy of a current building bylaw that permits are not required but that the work requires the vacancy of the unit in a way that necessitates ending the tenancy.
Some local governments have additional requirements, policies and bylaws that apply when landlords are performing renovations to a rental unit. Landlords should check with the local government where the rental unit is located to determine the requirements and submit evidence of meeting these requirements.
You can learn more about permit requirements on the Residential Tenancy Branch website and Policy Guideline 2B: Ending a Tenancy to Demolish, Renovate, or Convert a Rental Unit to a Permitted Use.

156.title: One Month Notice to End Tenancy For Cause - RTB 33
156.helpName: One Month Notice to End Tenancy For Cause - RTB 33
156.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the notice to end tenancy delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved notice to end tenancy form found here. A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end tenancy.

157.title: One Month Notice to End Tenancy For End of Employment - RTB 33
157.helpName: One Month Notice to End Tenancy For End of Employment - RTB 33
157.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the notice to end tenancy delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved notice to end tenancy form found here. A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end tenancy.

158.title: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy - Tenant Does Not Qualify For Subsidized Rental Unit - RTB 32
158.helpName: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Because Tenant Does Not Qualify For Subsidized Rental Unit - RTB 32
158.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the notice to end tenancy delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved notice to end tenancy form found here. A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end tenancy.

160.title: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy For Demolition or Conversion of a Rental Unit - RTB 29
160.helpName: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy For Demolition or Conversion of a Rental Unit - RTB 29
160.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the notice to end tenancy delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved notice to end tenancy form found here. A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end tenancy.

161.title: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy For Conversion of Manufactured Home Park - RTB 31
161.helpName: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy For Conversion of Manufactured Home Park - RTB 31
161.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the notice to end tenancy delivered to the tenant. You must use the approved notice to end tenancy form found here. A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end tenancy.

162.title: Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy - RTB 34
162.helpName: Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy - RTB 34
162.helpHtml:
Provide a completed Proof of Service Notice to End Tenancy and Written Demand to Pay Utilities (form RTB-34) to prove that the notice was delivered to the tenant.

Download a copy here.

163.title: Proof of Demolition or Conversion of a Rental unit
163.helpName: Proof of Demolition or Conversion of a Rental unit
163.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of all permits and approvals that are required by law to either demolish the rental unit or convert it to another use. Review our policy guideline here.

164.title: Proof of Conversion of Manufactured Home Park
164.helpName: Proof of Conversion of Manufactured Home Park
164.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of all permits and approvals that are required by law to convert the manufactured home park. Review our policy guideline here.

167.title: Registered mail receipt or other proof of service for notice
167.helpName: Registered mail receipt or other proof of service for notice
167.helpHtml: If the notice to end tenancy was sent by registered mail, you must provide a copy of the registered mail receipt. If the notice was sent by e-mail, you must provide proof of pre-agreement for sending documents by e-mail to demonstrate that the tenant has allowed for service in this manner.

201.title: Proof of Prevented Access
201.helpHtml: Provide proof that the landlord is preventing access.  This could include photos, audio or video recordings, witness statements or any other evidence to show that the landlord is preventing access.

203.title: Proof of Landlord's Refusal to Allow Assignment or Sublet
203.helpName: Proof of Landlord's Refusal to Allow Assignment or Sublet
203.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the landlord is unreasonably refusing your request to assign the tenancy agreement or sublet the rental unit or site.  This may include written communications or witness statements.

204.title: One Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
204.helpName: One Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
204.helpHtml:
Provide a copy of the notice delivered by the landlord. The landlord must use the approved One Month Notice to End Tenancy for Cause (form RTB-33 or RTB-33s). You are not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.
There is important information on page two of the notice that you should read carefully.

205.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
205.helpHtml: Provide evidence to disprove the cause the landlord claims on the notice.  This may include witness statements, written communications with the landlord, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to prove the landlord's notice is not warranted.

206.title: Employment Contract
206.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the employment contract with the landlord.

207.title: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
207.helpName: Two Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
207.helpHtml:
Provide a copy of the notice delivered by the landlord. The landlord must use the approved three-page Two Month Notice to End Tenancy for Landlord's Use of Property (form RTB-32). You are not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

There is important information on the notice that you should read carefully.

208.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
208.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the landlord does not intend in good faith to do what is indicated on the notice. Review our good faith requirement policy guideline .

209.title: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
209.helpName: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
209.helpHtml:
Provide a copy of the notice delivered by the landlord. The landlord must use the approved 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of Manufactured Home Park (form RTB-31). You are not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.
There is important information on page two of the notice that you should read carefully.

210.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
210.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the landlord does not intend in good faith to do what is indicated on the notice. Review our policy guideline on Ending a Manufactured Home Tenancy Agreement - Landlord Use of Property.

211.title: Proof Rent Was Paid or Not Owed
211.helpName: Proof Rent Was Paid or Not Owed
211.helpHtml:
Provide evidence to prove that the rent was paid in full within the required five days or evidence to prove that you withheld the rent for one of the following reasons:
1. you have an arbitrator's decision allowing the deduction; or
2. the landlord illegally increased the rent; or
3. the landlord has overcharged for a security or pet damage deposit; or
4. the landlord refused your written request for reimbursement of emergency repairs; or
5. you have the landlord's written permission allowing a rent reduction.

212.title: 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy Form
212.helpName: 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy Form
212.helpHtml:
Provide a copy of the notice delivered by the landlord. The landlord must use the approved 10 Day Notice to End Tenancy for Unpaid Rent or Utilities (form RTB-30). You are not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.
There is important information on page two of the notice that you should read carefully.

213.title: Notice of Rent Increase Form
213.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the landlord's Notice of Rent Increase.  The landlord must use the approved Notice of Rent Increase form (Form RTB-7 for residential tenancies or Forms RTB-45 or RTB- 11 for manufactured home park tenancies).  A verbal notice or notice not on one of the above forms is not valid.

215.title: Proof of Need for Emergency Repairs
215.helpName: Proof of Need for Emergency Repairs
215.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the need for repairs is urgent and the lack of repairs poses a risk to health or safety.  This may include witness statements, photos, written communications, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to prove the urgency of the repairs.

216.title: Proof of Request to the Landlord
216.helpName: Proof of Request to the Landlord
216.helpHtml: Provide evidence to support that you made two attempts to telephone the landlord to request the emergency repairs be done.

217.title: Reasons to Change Locks
217.helpHtml: Provide proof of why the locks should be changed without providing the landlord a key. Evidence may include witness statements, written communications, photos, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to support that the landlord is entering unlawfully or interfering with your right to quiet enjoyment. Learn more about quiet enjoyment on our website .

218.title: Reasons to Restrict Access
218.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove why the landlord's right to enter should be restricted.  This may include witness statements, written communications, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to support that the landlord is entering unlawfully.

220.title: Proof of Money Owed
220.helpHtml: Provide proof of the amount owed to you.  This could include receipts, invoices, estimates, account statements, photos or video recordings or any other evidence to show the amount of money owed.

221.title: Proof of Amount Paid
221.helpHtml: Provide proof of the costs of making the emergency repairs.  Evidence may include copies of invoices that you paid or copies of receipts for materials used in the emergency repairs.

222.title: Proof of Request for Emergency Repairs
222.helpName: Proof of Request for Emergency Repairs
222.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you attempted to contact the landlord at least two times before having the repairs completed.

223.title: Proof Address Was Provided
223.helpHtml: Provide proof that you gave the landlord your forwarding address in writing and the date you provided it. This may include email or text if you can prove that the landlord has received it. Otherwise your forwarding address should be on paper and served by an approved method. See our website regarding serving notices during a tenancy .

224.title: Proof More Time Is Needed
224.helpHtml: Provide proof that you had a serious and compelling reason for filing your application late.  An example of relevant evidence is a letter, on hospital letterhead, showing dates that you were admitted to hospital and that your condition prevented you from contacting another person to act on your behalf.

225.title: Proof of Landlord's Non-Compliance
225.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the landlord is not complying with the Act, regulations or tenancy agreement.  Evidence may include the section(s) of the Act, regulations or tenancy agreement the landlord is violating, audio or video recordings of landlord violations, proof of the landlord not following proper process or written communications requesting the landlord comply.

226.title: Proof of Prevented Access
226.helpHtml: Provide proof that the landlord is preventing access.  This could include photos, audio or video recordings, witness statements or any other evidence to show that the landlord is preventing access.

227.title: Proof of Tenancy
227.helpHtml: Provide proof of your tenancy.  This could be a copy of your tenancy agreement, proof of payment of a security deposit or a copy of a Residential Tenancy Branch decision cancelling a notice to end tenancy.

228.title: Proof of Withheld Service or Facility
228.helpName: Proof of Withheld Service or Facility
228.helpHtml: Provide proof that the landlord is not providing the service or facility.  This could include written communications, photos, audio or video recordings or witness statements.

229.title: Proof of Right to Service
229.helpHtml: Provide proof that you are entitled to the service or to access the facility.  This could include sections of your tenancy agreement or written communications with the landlord stating the service or facility is included.  Note: If services or facilities are in place for an extended period of time, they may become part of your agreement.

230.title: Proof of Need for Repairs
230.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove the repairs are needed.  This may include witness statements, photos, written communications, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to prove the repairs are needed and the landlord failed to complete the requested repairs within a reasonable time.

231.title: Proof of Request to the Landlord
231.helpName: Proof of Request to the Landlord
231.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you notified the landlord of the repairs needed and allowed a reasonable time for the landlord to complete them.  Evidence may include written communications such as letters or email correspondence to the landlord.

232.title: Proof of Property to Be Returned
232.helpName: Proof of Property to Be Returned
232.helpHtml: Provide details and proof of the property that needs to be returned.  This could include written communications to the landlord requesting the return of the property, photos of the items in your rental unit, witness statements about the personal property, receipts or bank statements showing purchase of items.

233.title: Proof to Support Rent Reduction
233.helpHtml: Provide proof to support the amount of the rent reduction requested.  This could include evidence to prove your claimed loss of use, loss of quiet enjoyment, loss of services or facilities, additional expenses or any other evidence to support the reduction requested.

234.title: Proof of Request to the Landlord
234.helpName: Proof of Request to the Landlord
234.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that you requested that the landlord resolve the issue.  Include evidence to support the landlord's non-compliance with the Act, regulations or tenancy agreement.

235.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
235.helpHtml: Provide proof that you do qualify for subsidized housing.  This may include copies of letters responding to the landlord's request for proof of current income, a copy of the criteria for subsidized housing and documentation to show that you meet the criteria.

236.title: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
236.helpName: 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
236.helpHtml: Provide a copy of the notice delivered to the tenant.  You must use the approved 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of Manufactured Home Park (form RTB-31).  A tenant is not required to dispute a verbal notice to end a tenancy.

237.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
237.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that either the rental unit or site is not provided as part of your employment or that your employment with the landlord has not ended.  This may include witness statements, written communications with the landlord, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to prove the landlord's notice is not warranted.

238.title: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
238.helpName: Four Month Notice to End Tenancy Form
238.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that either the rental unit or site is not provided as part of your employment or that your employment with the landlord has not ended.  This may include witness statements, written communications with the landlord, audio or video recordings or any other evidence to prove the landlord's notice is not warranted.

239.title: Proof Notice Is Not Valid
239.helpHtml: Provide evidence to prove that the landlord does not intend in good faith to do what is indicated on the notice. Review our good faith requirement policy guideline .

240.title: Forwarding address letter, (move-out) condition inspection report, or RTB-47 (recommended)
240.helpName: Forwarding address letter, (move-out) condition inspection report, or RTB-47 (recommended)
240.helpHtml: Provide the forwarding address letter that you served to the landlord; or the move-out condition inspection report if it contains the forwarding address.

241.title: Proof of Service of Forwarding Address (RTB-41)
241.helpName: Proof of Service of Forwarding Address (RTB-41)

245.title: Move-in condition inspection report
245.helpHtml:
Provide documentation to prove the condition of the rental unit.

Include a copy of the completed Move-In Condition Inspection Report (form RTB-27) showing the condition of the rental unit at the start of the tenancy. Otherwise, if you were not given at least two opportunities to participate in the move-in condition inspection or if the landlord did not provide you with a copy of the report, indicate this on the Tenant's Direct Request Worksheet (RTB-40).

246.title: Move-out condition inspection report
246.helpHtml:
Provide documentation to prove the condition of the rental unit.

Include a copy of the completed Move-In Condition Inspection Report (form RTB-27) showing the condition of the rental unit at the end of the tenancy. Otherwise, if you were not given at least two opportunities to participate in the move-out condition inspection or if the landlord did not provide you with a copy of the report, indicate this on the Tenant's Direct Request Worksheet (RTB-40).

247.title: Copy of notice to end tenancy (Forms #RTB-29, 31, or 32)
247.helpName: Copy of notice to end tenancy (Forms #RTB-29, 31, or 32)
247.helpHtml:
You must provide a copy of one of these notices to end tenancy:
  • Form #RTB-29 Four Month Notice to End Tenancy for Demolition or Conversion of the Rental Unit to Another Use
  • Form #RTB-31 12 Month Notice to End Tenancy for Conversion of Manufactured Home Park
  • Form #RTB-32 Two Month Notice to End Tenancy for Landlord's Use of Property

248.title: Proof landlord failed to take required steps
248.helpName: Proof landlord failed to take required steps
248.helpHtml: Provide evidence that the landlord did not take the required steps for ending your tenancy

249.title: Notice of Additional Rent Increase with attached details document
249.helpName: Notice of Additional Rent Increase with attached details document
249.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the Notice of Additional Rent Increase form (RTB-53) with the details document that was served with it

250.title: Additional Rent Increase Decision
250.helpHtml: You must provide a copy of the Additional Rent Increase decision which sets out the eligible amount of the capital expenditure for your rental unit

251.title: Previous Notices of Rent Increase(s)
251.helpHtml: If you have a previous Notice of Rent Increase form you may submit it here

252.title: Proof of tenancy
252.helpHtml: Provide proof that the your tenancy is under the jurisdiction of the Residential Tenancy Branch

253.title: Copy of manufactured home park rules
253.helpName: Copy of manufactured home park rules
253.helpHtml: Provide a copy of your manufactured home park rules

254.title: Proof tenant not complying with manufactured home park rules
254.helpName: Proof tenant not complying with manufactured home park rules
254.helpHtml: Provide evidence that the tenant is not complying with the manufactured home park rules

55.title: Proof of Service Notice of Direct Request Proceeding
55.helpName: Proof of Service Notice of Direct Request Proceeding
55.helpHtml: Provide the completed Proof of Service Notice of Direct Request Proceeding (form RTB-44) provided to you by the Residential Tenancy Branch with your Dispute Resolution Proceeding Package.

57.title: Fee Waiver, Income Assistance Proof
57.helpHtml:
Proof of enrolment in income assistance may be confirmed by providing:
  • bank statements for the two most recent months showing Income Assistance benefit direct deposits; or
  • letter from Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction which tenants can obtain by submitting a completed Consent to Disclosure of Information (form HR3189) to the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction;
  • confirmation of recent application for Income Assistance.

58.checkboxTitle: The income includes employment insurance benefits
58.title: Fee Waiver, Employment Insurance Proof
58.helpHtml:
Proof of enrolment in employment insurance benefits may be confirmed by providing:
  • bank statements for the two most recent months showing Employment Insurance benefit direct deposits, or
  • Employment Insurance benefits statement.

59.checkboxTitle: The income includes employment income from an employer
59.title: Fee Waiver, Employment Income Proof
59.helpHtml:
Proof of employment income may be confirmed by providing:
  • employment pay stubs for the two most recent months; or
  • bank statements for the two most recent months employment income direct deposits.

60.title: Fee Waiver, Pension Income Proof
60.helpHtml:
Proof of receipt of pension benefits may be confirmed by providing:
  • pension statements;
  • bank statements for the two most recent months showing pension(s) direct deposits.

61.title: Fee Waiver, Scholarship Income Proof
61.helpHtml: Proof of receipt of scholarships can be provided by submitting statements showing annual amount of the scholarship(s) divided by the number of months in the student's school year.

62.checkboxTitle: The income includes another source of income (not listed above)
62.title: Fee Waiver, Other Income Proof
62.helpHtml: Provide proof of that other source of income

63.checkboxTitle: I don't have the above, but can provide bank statements for the two most recent months
63.title: Fee Waiver, Bank Statement Proof
63.helpHtml: Provide bank statements for all active bank accounts for the two most recent months

64.title: Proof Notice was Served
64.helpHtml: Provide a registered mail receipt or written receipt signed by the tenant or witnessed by another person confirming the notice was served.

69.title: Application for Expedited Hearing Old Form (RTB-12-EXH)

74.title: Application, Landlord Request to Amend (RTB-42L or RTB-42O)

75.title: Application, Tenant Request to Amend (RTB-42T or RTB-42O)

82.title: Landlord Application, Direct Request Old Form (RTB-12LDR)

84.title: Application, Sub Service Pre Office Submission (RTB-13)

96.title: Landlord Application, Direct Request (RTB-12L-DR) and supporting forms

98.title: Tenant Application, Direct Request (RTB-12T-DR) and supporting forms
